chef_short_description: Award-winning chef with a passion for mexican fusion cuisine

recipes.cooking_method: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 2. Add the ground beef and cook until browned and cooked through, breaking it up with a spoon as it cooks. 3. Add the taco seasoning and stir to combine. 4. In a large bowl, combine the chopped lettuce, cherry tomatoes, shredded cheese, and crushed tortilla chips. 5. Add the cooked ground beef and stir to combine. 6. In a small bowl, mix together the sour cream, salsa, and chopped cilantro. 7. Serve the taco salad with the sour cream mixture on top.

ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. 2. In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, black beans, salsa, cilantro, cumin, and chili powder. 3. Wrap the tortillas in a damp paper towel and microwave for 30 seconds to soften. 4. Place a spoonful of the chicken mixture onto each tortilla, roll up, and place seam-side down in a 9x13 inch baking dish. 5. Sprinkle the shredded cheese over the top of the enchiladas, followed by the sliced olives and chopped green onions. 6. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

1. Preheat the broiler. 2. Place the poblano peppers on a baking sheet and broil for 5-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until the skins areblackened and blistered. 3. Remove the peppers from the oven and place them in a plastic bag to steam for 10-15 minutes. 4. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, cooked rice, shredded cheese, chopped onion, minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and black pepper. 5. Carefully peel the skins off the peppers and slice a small opening in each pepper to remove the seeds and membranes. 6. Stuff the beef and rice mixture into each pepper, being careful not to tear the pepper. 7. In a shallow dish, beat the eggs. 8. In another shallow dish, combine the flour with a pinch of salt. 9. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 10. Dip each stuffed pepper into the flour mixture, then into the beaten eggs, and place it in the hot oil. 11. Fry the peppers for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown. 12. Remove the peppers from the skillet and place them in a baking dish. 13. Pour the enchilada sauce over the top of the peppers. 14. Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the peppers are tender. 15. Serve the chile rellenos hot, garnished with additional shredded cheese and chopped cilantro, if desired.
